trial_identification.studytitle: Healthy eating behaviours in male gym users
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The body image program: targeting self-esteem and body image in male gym users between the ages of 18 and 65 years

interventions.interventions: The intervention will be delivered as a small group seminar by a provisionally registered psychologist under the supervision of a registered psychologist. The intervention will take place at Bond University and will run for approximently 4 hours for one day. The intervention will focus on educating male gym users about ideal body image and healthy eating behaviours.
interventions.comparator: The control group will not recieve intervention. The control group will be taken from a sample of participants who have completed a questionnaire booklet.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Increase Self esteem - The Rosenberg Self Esteem Scale (RSES; Rosenberg, 1965)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline at 2 week follow-up after treatment

primaryOutcome.outcome: Increase Body Image - Body Image Avoidance Questionnaire (BIAQ; Rosen, Srebnik, Saltzberg & Wendt, 1991).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline at 2 week follow-up after treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Number of sessions at gym per week - participants will complete a demographic questionnaire
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline at 2 week follow-up after treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Average time at gym for each session - participants will complete a demographic questionnaire
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline at 2 week follow-up after treatment

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Gym users male between ages of 18 and 65 years
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Under the age of 18 years of age Female non-gym users

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: University Drive, (Off Cottesloe Drive) Robina QLD 4226

fundingsource.fundingaddress: University Drive, (Off Cottesloe Drive) Robina QLD 4226

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study :Healthy and Unhealthy Eating Behaviours in Male Gym Users (18-65years)" is aimed at working with male gym users who have low self-esteem, poor body image and unhealthy eating behaviours. It is designed to provide them with education around body image and the influence of the media as well as the signs and sympomts of unhealthy eating behaviours.
